name: Amir Shpilka
content: Web Page of Amir Shpilka Amir Shpilka Main Students Publications Courses Talks About me I am a faculty member at the Department of Computer Science at Tel-Aviv University. I am part of the theory of computation group. My main research area is complexity theory, specifically algebraic complexity, but I am also interested in coding theory, communication complexity, algebraic property testing, analysis of boolean functions and pseudo randomness. Announcements Fall semester 2018-9 I will be on sabbatical in the fall semester of 2018-19 at NYU. Avi is 60! A Celebration of Mathematics and Computer ScienceSanjeev Arora, Boaz Barak, Ran Raz, Peter Sarnak and I organized a workshop celebrating Avi Wigderson's 60th birthday. WACT 2016 Michael A. Forbes, Ramprasad Saptharishi and I organized a Workshop on Algebraic Complexity Theory (WACT 2016) from 3rd to 12th February 2016 in Tel Aviv University. The website contains videos and slides of talks as well as videos of a crash course on algebraic complexity.
